user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.1 is: A project shall not contain unreachable code.

</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of create_response_object:
```c
static struct MHD_Response *
create_response_object (void)
{
#if MHD_VERSION >= 0x00097701
  if (NULL != body_dyn)
    return MHD_create_response_from_buffer_static (body_dyn_size,
                                                   body_dyn);
  else if (tool_params.empty)
    return MHD_create_response_empty (MHD_RF_NONE);

  return MHD_create_response_from_buffer_static (MHD_STATICSTR_LEN_ (tiny_body),
                                                 tiny_body);

#else  /* MHD_VERSION < 0x00097701 */
  if (NULL != body_dyn)
    return MHD_create_response_from_buffer (body_dyn_size,
                                            (void *) body_dyn,
                                            MHD_RESPMEM_PERSISTENT);
  else if (tool_params.empty)
    return MHD_create_response_from_buffer (0,
                                            (void *) tiny_body,
                                            MHD_RESPMEM_PERSISTENT);

  return MHD_create_response_from_buffer (MHD_STATICSTR_LEN_ (tiny_body),
                                          (void *) tiny_body,
                                          MHD_RESPMEM_PERSISTENT);
#endif /* MHD_VERSION < 0x00097701 */
}
```
</target_code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation: The only parts of this function that could represent unreachable code are the two mutually-exclusive preprocessor branches and the conditional-return paths inside them; depending on the build-time MHD_VERSION macro one entire branch will not be compiled, and depending on run-time conditions some conditional arms may never be taken. All other fragments in the function (the function signature, the enclosing braces, the return statements visible inside a compiled branch) do not introduce unreachable code within the same compilation unit: each compiled branch provides return statements that cover all control-flow paths, and there is no code following an unconditional return in a single compiled branch. Therefore only the shown preprocessor-guarded blocks and their conditional arms need further investigation for potential unreachable-code concerns.
